item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
foryou:

iâ€™ll help you out with achieving that ncs style

Iâ€™d be honestly interested to know what you have planned.

It was all pretty tight and slick production-wise; all well made*, but I honestly didnâ€™t hear anything while scanning through their â€˜best of 2017â€™ playlist that sounded distinctly different to other labels/tracks in those genres - either in the style of tracks or the production.

So, Iâ€™m curious to know what youâ€™re hearing that Iâ€™m not - and how you plan to achieve it in Auxy.

(* Imo, the production quality is beyond whatâ€™s possible in Auxy.)

item.title: We now have guitars ðŸŽ¸ what sounds are similar to NCS songs
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Blue-Jy:

any song that comes from NoCopywriteSounds

*ahem*

NoCopyrightSounds

Big fan, eh?

 
From what I can tell, it covers a range of electronic sub-genres. Not sure thereâ€™s an NCS â€˜soundâ€™, unless you mean a fairly standard EDM palette.

Thatâ€™s not a criticism of the quality of the music. I just donâ€™t hear a distinctly different â€˜soundâ€™ running through NCS releases.

Ref: https://soundcloud.com/nocopyrightsounds/sets/bestof2017

item.title: We now have guitars ðŸŽ¸ what sounds are similar to NCS songs
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
foryou:

Layer Silk (7 Skies pack), Strain (original synths), Gossip (also original synths), and Spray (Destiny pack) for the lead and then layer Slope (7 Skies pack) and Subway (original pack) for the bass.

This works great,
also Fragment,Stress, and subway work decent together. A high octave Subway lead makes a good melody. Low octave of course makes a good bass
